programDetails.name: GMES & Africa Phase I
programDetails.description: GMES and Africa Phase 1 (2017–2021) marked the launch of a truly pan-African Earth-Observation partnership between the African Union Commission and the European Commission, establishing two core services — Natural & Water Resources and Marine & Coastal Areas — delivered through 12 (13) consortia spanning 45–51 African countries and over 120 institutions, with the aim of strengthening institutional, human and technical capacities, improving access to and sharing of EO data and services, implementing geo-portals and training programmes, and contributing to sustainable development and policy-making across the continent.

pillars_LogFrame.name: Infrastructure and Data
pillars_LogFrame.description: Focused on setting up e-Stations, data access agreements (e.g. Copernicus, EUMETSAT), and supporting tools like geoportals for service delivery across the continent. Trained staff and ensured access to real-time satellite data streams.

pillars_LogFrame.name: Service Delivery
pillars_LogFrame.description: Covered the development and operationalization of EO-based services, such as flood monitoring, crop mapping, aquaculture forecasting, and coastal vulnerability assessments, tailored to regional needs.

pillars_LogFrame.name: Capacity Development
pillars_LogFrame.description: Emphasized training through the Digital Learning Platform (DLP), university networks, scholarships, internships, and regional workshops—spanning Infrastructure, Services, Communication, and EO Management.

pillars_LogFrame.name: Awareness Raising and Outreach
pillars_LogFrame.description: Included multi-platform communication (social media, websites, newsletters), public engagement at exhibitions and forums, policy briefs, and media campaigns to promote the programme’s results and EO applications.

pillars_LogFrame.name: Cross-Fertilization and Knowledge Management
pillars_LogFrame.description: Although not always listed as a standalone workstream, it was widely practiced via Technical Expert Groups, joint service exchanges, and consortium collaboration meetings to ensure learning across regions

continentalPolicies: Science, Technology and Innovation Strategy for Africa (STISA)

consortia.name: Water and Natural Resources Management in Central Africa (GERNAC)
consortia.leadInstitution: International Commission for the Congo-Oubangui-Sangha Basin (CICOS)
consortia.description: Integrated EO services for water and natural resources, focusing on navigation, hydrological balance and flooded areas dynamics.
services: Monitoring of water levels for river navigation
Monitoring the dynamics of flooded areas

consortia.name: Monitoring Natural Resources and Food Security in East Africa Region
consortia.leadInstitution: IGAD Climate Prediction and Applications Centre (ICPAC)
consortia.description: EO-based monitoring of natural habitats, forests, rangelands and seasonal crop conditions to strengthen regional food security.

consortia.name: Regional Centre for Mapping of Resources for Development
consortia.leadInstitution: Regional Centre for Mapping of Resources for Development (RCMRD)
consortia.description: EO services for land degradation and wetlands, plus an open regional reference vector database.
services: Open Geographical Regional Reference Vector Database

members.name: Higher Council for Environment and Natural Resources (HCENR)
Ministry of Land, Water and Environment

consortia.name: Wetland Assessment and Monitoring Platform for Transboundary River Basins in Southern Africa (WeMAST)
consortia.leadInstitution: Southern Africa Science Centre for Climate Change and Adaptive Land Management (SASSCAL)
consortia.description: Platform for assessment and monitoring of wetlands in transboundary river basins (Cuvelai, Okavango, Limpopo, Zambezi).

consortia.name: Land Degradation Monitoring and Assessment
consortia.leadInstitution: Observatoire du Sahara et du Sahel (OSS)
consortia.description: EO tools for monitoring land degradation and seasonal agriculture; water use monitoring in irrigated areas.
services: Monitoring land degradation status and trends (MISLAND)
Seasonal Agriculture Monitoring and Early Warning (MISBAR)
Estimating withdrawals and water use in irrigated areas

members.name: Centre for Environment and Development for the Arab Region and Europe (CEDARE)
Centre National de la Cartographie et de la Télédétection (CNCT)
Royal Centre for Remote Sensing and Space Studies (CRTS)
Libyan Center for Remote Sensing and Space Science (LCRSSS)
Centre d’Etudes et de Recherche des Télécommunications (CERT)

consortia.name: Multi-scale Flood Monitoring and Assessment Services for West Africa (MiFMASS)
consortia.description: Multi-scale flood monitoring, forecasting and damage assessment to reduce disaster risk in vulnerable countries.

members.name: Institut Supérieur d'Études Spatiales et Télécommunications (ISESTEL)

consortia.name: Water and Natural Resources Management in West Africa
consortia.description: EO services for rangelands, agriculture, coastal erosion and water resources to support decision-making.

members.name: Direction Nationale de l'Environnement et des Forêts (DNEF)
Direction de la Planification et de la Modernisation des Services de l'Eau (DPMW)

consortia.name: Marine and Coastal Operations for Southern Africa (MarCOSouth)
consortia.leadInstitution: Council for Scientific and Industrial Research (CSIR)
consortia.description: Marine and coastal services supporting fisheries, maritime safety and socio-economic development.
services: Monitoring and forecasting physical & biological oceanography variables
Marine & Maritime Service (ship traffic, safety at sea)

members.name: Institute for Marine Science, University of Dar es Salaam (IMSUDS)

consortia.name: Coastal and Marine Services for the Indian Ocean
consortia.description: Operational marine and coastal services for Indian Ocean SIDS and neighbouring states.
services: Coral reef and seagrass bed mapping

members.name: Institut Halieutique et des Sciences Marines (IHSM)
Kenya Marine and Fisheries Research Institute (KMFRI)

consortia.name: Developing an EO Operational Application for Coastal Ecosystems (NAfCOAST)
consortia.leadInstitution: National Authority for Remote Sensing and Space Science (NARSS)
consortia.description: EO tools for mapping, monitoring and assessing coastal ecosystems; oil spill monitoring; coastal vulnerability mapping.

consortia.name: University of Ghana
consortia.leadInstitution: African Regional Centre for Space Science and Technology Education (CSSTE)
consortia.description: Operational EO services to improve marine, fisheries and environmental policies in West Africa.

members.name: Nigerian Institute for Oceanography and Marine Research (NIOMR)
Centre for Oceanographic Research of Dakar (CRODT)

consortia.name: Surveillance de la Forêt Equatoriale, Suivi et Evaluation (SEFAC)
consortia.leadInstitution: Agence Gabonaise d'Études et d'Observations Spatiales (AGEOS)
consortia.description: Operational EO services to monitor equatorial forest dynamics, illegal logging and land use/cover change.
services: Forest cover change and logging activity monitoring
Protected areas and biodiversity hotspot mapping
Land use and land cover mapping

members.name: Office Burundais pour la Protection de l'Environnement (OBPE)

consortia.name: African Regional Centre for Space Science and Technology Education (EO-NA)
consortia.leadInstitution: African Regional Centre for Space Science and Technology Education (CSSTE)
consortia.description: Training and EO applications for water and land management across North African countries.
services: Training and capacity building in EO applications

consortia.name: Water and Natural Resources Applications (SADC-CSC) — withdrew after 12 months
consortia.description: EO applications for drought/flood monitoring, water resources and agriculture in Southern Africa. (Consortium withdrew after 12 months of Phase I.)

members.name: Botswana University of Agriculture and Natural Resources (BUAN)

internalNetworks.name: GMES & Africa Academia Network (GAAN)
internalNetworks.description: Operational network of ~27 African universities advancing EO education and research.

strategicPartnerships: European Commission (Copernicus data access agreement, June 2018)

privateSectorEngagement.serviceDevelopment: ≈ 20 African private companies involved within the >122 participating institutions
